e="preserve">Ruth Mosselle Apilado ("née" Mays; April 30, 1908) is an American writer and anti-racism activist. She is known as the founder of the quarterly magazine "America's Intercultural Magazine" ("AIM"). She founded "AIM" in 1973.
Apilado was born in Chicago, Illinois. She turned 100 in 2008, and 110 in 2018.
